questions.explanation:
Indian & indian.

	Indian ink, Indian Mutiny, Indian Ocean etc. Indian rope-trick is the supposed Indian feat of climbing an unsupported rope. An Indian summer is a period of unusually settled warm weather after the end of summer.

questions.text: - box, - card, - Eve, - Island, - pudding, - stocking, - tree
questions.explanation:
Christmas & christmas.

	Christmas box, Christmas card, Christmas Eve etc.

Double & double.

	Double agent, double chin, double cream etc.

Green & green.

	Green Beret, green dragon, green fingers etc. Green Beret is an informal name for a British or American commando. Green fingers is a considerable talent to grow plants often known as green thumb in USA and Canada.

Roman & roman.

	Roman candle, Roman Catholic, Roman Empire etc. Roman nose is a nose having a high prominent bridge.

questions.correct: Fairy & fairy & Faerie & faerie & Faery & faery
questions.explanation:
Fairy & fairy & Faerie & faerie & Faery & faery.

	Fairy godmother, fairy lights, fairy ring etc. A fairy ring is a ring of dark luxuriant vegetation in grassy ground seasonally marked by a ring of mushrooms.

questions.text: - bean, - chalk, - doors, - dressing, - mustard, - polish, - window.
questions.explanation:
French & french.

	French bean, french chalk, french doors etc. French chalk is a compact variety of talc used to mark cloth or remove grease stains from materials. French dressing is a salad dressing made from oil and vinegar with seasonings.

questions.text: - bat, - cocktail, - fly, - machine, - salad, - tree.
questions.explanation:
Fruit & fruit.

	Fruit bat, fruit cocktail, fruit machine etc.

Gold & gold.

	Gold Coast, gold dust, gold medal etc. Gold Coast was the former name of Ghana until 1957.

questions.text: - nurse, - owl, - safe, - school, - shift, - watchman
questions.explanation:
Night & night.

	Night nurse, night owl, night safe etc. A night owl is a person who is or prefers to be up and about late at night just like Fun Trivia players.

Dutch & dutch.

	Dutch auction, Dutch barn, Dutch cheese etc. A Dutch auction is an auction in which the price is lowered by stages until a buyer is found. Dutch courage is false courage gained from drinking alcohol.

Grey & grey & Gray & gray.

	Grey area, Grey Friar, grey matter etc. A Grey Friar is a Franciscan friar. Grey matter is the greyish tissue of the brain and spinal cord which you are using to answer these questions.

questions.text: - Death, - eye, - Forest, - Hills, - hole, - ice, - magic, - widow
questions.explanation:
Black & black.

	Black Death, black eye, Black Forest etc. Black Death was a form of bubonic plague pandemic in Europe and Asia during the 14th century when it killed over 50 million people. The Black Forest is a hilly wooded region of Germany.

Irish & irish.

	Irish coffee, Irish Sea, Irish setter etc. An Irish coffee is a hot coffee mixed with Irish whiskey and topped with double cream.

Monkey & monkey.

	Monkey business, monkey nut, monkey puzzle etc. Monkey business is mischievous, dishonest or meddlesome behavior. A monkey nut is another name for a peanut and a monkey puzzle is known as a Chile pine tree. A monkey suit is American slang for a man's evening dress.

Mother & mother.

	Mother country, Mother Goose, Mother Hubbard etc. Mother Goose was the imaginary author of the collection of nursery rhymes by French author Charles Perrault. Mother Hubbard was a character in a nursery rhyme.

Granny & grannie.

	Granny bond, granny flat, granny knot etc. A granny flat is self-contained accommodation within or built onto a house suitable for an elderly parent. A granny bond is an index-linked savings certificate originally available only to people over retirement age.

Olive & olive.

	Olive branch, olive drab, olive green etc. Olive drab is a dull but fairly strong greyish-olive colour especially the colour of the uniform of the American Army.

questions.text: - admiral, - carpet, - dwarf, - flag, - herring, - pepper, - tape
questions.explanation:
Red & red.

	Red admiral, red carpet, red dwarf etc.

Strip & strip.

	Strip cartoon, strip club, strip lighting

Slave & slave.

	Slave cylinder, slave driver, slave ship etc. Slave cylinder is a small cylinder containing a piston that operates the brake shoes or pads in hydraulic brake systems as in a car.

Turkish & turkish.

	Turkish bath, Turkish coffee, Turkish delight etc.

questions.text: - curtain, - film, - fuse, - glass, - match, - net, - pin, - razor
questions.explanation:
Safety & safety & Safty & safty.

	Safety curtain, safety glass, safety pin etc.

Rubber & rubber.

	Rubber band, rubber cheque, rubber plant etc. A rubber cheque is one that bounces.

Elephant & elephant.

	Elephant bird, elephant grass, elephant seal etc. An elephant shrew is a small active African mammal having an elongated nose, large ears and long hind legs. An elephant bird was a large, now extinct, flightless bird whose remains have been found in Madagascar. Hope you enjoyed the quiz and at the same time learnt something new.
